oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shelby Avenue Baptist Church, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Shelby Avenue Baptist Church located at 401 S. Eleventh Street in the East Nashville neighborhood of Nashville, Tennessee. According to the cornerstone, the original building was erected in 1916. The church has changed names several times over the years. The current name is Greater Faith Missionary Baptist Church. The foundation is made of rough cut stone. The exterior walls are red brick. The roof is gabled and hipped with tar shingles. The windows are arched with colored glass and plexi-glass covers. The doors are wood. Special features include a pediment supported by four columns, a portico and an addition added to the front of the building in 1950. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Shelby Avenue Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Greater Faith Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
